NOT AVAILABLE from tayda. I may make another version that uses non rail-to-rail op-amps, like MCP602 or LM358. If you use them in current design you don’t get the full pot range

Package: Push Button Switch Caps White Color 6x5mm
Mini Jumper 2.54mm Gold Plated Closed Cover
8 pin DIP IC Socket Adaptor Solder Type

Tayda link, notes: Total cost of Tayda cart with the Arduino is about $10, without it’s about $6,3. CHEAP!
The amount needed for tayda ordering may differ, ex: you only need to order one 40 pin header strip and cut to right sizes
You may have to experiment with lower values for R10, until you get -5V at the anode (pin 3) of the LM4040
You can replace the expensive and hard to source LM4040LP-5 with a 10V Zener, you just have to replace R3 and R6 with 200k resistors. The Zener and resistors and 14 cents to the cart
LED orientation isn’t vital so long as it’s consistent. Use LED orientation indicated on PCB (shorter lead to square pad) to have original Branches colors
Switch orientation isn’t vital so long as it’s consistent. Just changes which mode corresponds to pushed/unpushed position
You could just use 1K resistors for R11 and R12, it would save ordering extra 220R ones. It just makes LEDs slightly duller
You can get two 6mm M3 screws and a 11mm M3 standoff to hold the control and brain boars together, but I don’t find them necessary
Auto-gate generation isn’t implemented yet, might never be
